Shamsher Singh Puri.translation: Just as a man drinking wine is unaware of its effect on him and he keeps consuming more till he falls unconscious.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijs qrwˆ midrw pIˆidAwˆ hoXw Es dw mrm pRBwv Asr nhIˆ jwxIdw; pr Cky pIiqAwˆ ipCoˆ mqvwly ho ky byhoS ho jweIdw hY, qwˆ AQvw; CkI aupr CkI hI jweIdI hY qwˆ pqw lgdw hY ik ieh kIh Agy ip`Cy dI su`D Bulw dyx vwlI vsqU hY[

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy Bwir Bytq Bqwrih n Bydu jwnih; auidq ADwn Awn ichin idKwq hY [

Shamsher Singh Puri.translation: Just as a wife making love with her husband is unaware of the effect at that time but it appears in the form of her pregnancy.

lines.gurmukhi: kir pir mwnku n lwgq hY BwrI qol; mol sMiKAw dmkn hyrq ihrwiq hY [

Shamsher Singh Puri.translation: Just as one feels no weight of a diamond on one's hand but when sold, amazes all with the money that it brings forth.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy gur AMimRq bcn suin mwnY isK; jwnY mihmw jau suK swgr smwq hY [374[

Shamsher Singh Puri.translation: So does a Sikh of the Guru listens to the elixir-like sermon of the True Guru and adopts it with mind, words and deeds. He then realises its greatness and merges in the Lord-the ocean of all comforts and peace. (A Naam practitioner only knows the ecstasy
